Ella Wheeler Wilcox (November 5, 1850  October 30, 1919) was an American 
author and poet. Her best-known work was Poems of Passion. Her most enduring 
work was "Solitude", which contains the lines, "Laugh, and the world laughs with 
you; weep, and you weep alone" ... She started writing poetry at a very early age, 
and was well known as a poet...
